This loft was a cute downtown night on our long trip.
They do not want pets because of the lofts gorgeous original hard wood floors.
Place is spotless and cozy.
The bed is old and losing comfort.
Parking situation is my only true complaint and the property cannot do anything about that. You canâ€™t street park overnight so then your stuck in a parking lot you canâ€™t see by a sketchy motelâ€¦ did see quite a bit of sketch people at night. And a crotch rocket woke us up from a dead sleep in the middle of the night. Scared my whole family to death. If you want a quiet oasis.. this isnâ€™t it. If you want a weekend down town and plan on going out and staying up this is for you.
The owners are amazing and responsive. The loft is cute and clean!!! Just know what your getting into.

If you are going to spend some time in Spearfish or in the larger Black Hills area, Tracy's place is just perfect. Everything you need (restaurants, coffee, grocery, drinks) is literally a block or two away. The building is a restored historic landmark building and it perfectly balances old charm with new conveniences. It's very secure and very quiet for sleeping.
Only comment to make is that you do need to climb a floor of stairs to get to the apartment in case this is an issue for you. It was not for us but maybe would be for some older visitors.

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Tracy's place is a lovely and I believe the best available spot in Spearfish. I appreciated the very easy self check-in. While there is no designated space, parking for us was quite easy -- we arrived on a Friday afternoon, a spot was available in front of the apartment and due to our time of arrival, we didn't need to move the car after the two hour time limit. The bed was very comfortable and the shades do a great job of blocking out the light. You are in downtown Spearfish (adorable!), overlooking the main street and there is traffic noise. However, the thoughtfully provided fan provides the white noise needed to make sleeping easy. I appreciate the high quality linens for the extra mattress or couch -- my daughter was very comfortable. The photos represent the apartment very accurately. Rugs would go a long way in making the space cozier and there are only two (mismatched) wine glasses.

Stayed with kids
review_text: My family stayed at Tracy's charming loft for one night during our cross-country drive, and it was awesome! The loft is beautiful, stylish, and well considered, and the downtown Spearfish location is greatâ€” less than a block away from a wonderful natural food store (Good Earth), a yummy Italian restaurant (Nonna's Kitchen), and a fantastic breakfast/coffee/tea spot (Blackbird Espresso). Our daughter slept on the pull-out sofa, and I was happy to discover it had a much nicer mattress than the average sleeper. We also loved having a bathtub and a comfy king bed. All in all, it was a very enjoyable stay, and I cannot imagine a better spot in Spearfish (though I am sure her other loft is just as lovely). Thanks, Tracy! :)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: ATTENTION: Only stay at this place if you want to be absolutely blown away by an incredibly charming and characteristic apartment overlooking the quaint Main Street Spearfish has to offer. In terms of location, this place is exactly where you want to be: walking distance to cafes, bars, parks, etc. This was a very secured apartment, exceptionally up-to-date & modern while at the same time, rustic with some unique character. The tall ceilings and huge windows gave this 2nd story apartment a great open, airy feeling (don't worry, the beautiful windows had black-out shades if you are wanting some seclusion). Everything was remarkably clean and it felt very comfortable. I honestly don't believe I could ever speak highly enough for this place. If you EVER have the chance to book this place in the Black Hills, DO IT! Thanks again Tracy!

name: Diana
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Spent four peaceful nights in the Secret Garden's Rose Room. I came alone to explore the Northern Black Hills, and the Secret Garden in Spearfish was the perfect base. I wanted a quiet and comfortable room with private bath. The Rose Room was perfect as it is upstairs facing away from the back garden, so very quiet. It has a large private bathroom with a sink, toilet, tub and shower. Plenty of towels. Big comfy bed and a big couch. There is even a little gas fireplace! No ceiling fan but there is an A/C unit which kept things nice and cool. The host Sonya was awesome! There is no curfew. Bicycles are available (I chose to walk). After my first night I discovered I was the only guest in the house...it was nice walking around in my (provided) bathrobe! I enjoyed using the extremely well-stocked kitchen to make breakfast and dinner. Each room has designated space in the refrigerator. The hot tub was CLEAN and HOT!! Really enjoyed my stay, recommended!!

review_text:
Pictures do not do this incredible home justice. The moment you pull up, you will be amazed! Choosing an off the grid home that is completely independent and self-sustsinable, we had no idea what to really expect. Well, this home does not disappoint to give you a location to enjoy all of the Black Hills, and every luxury you are used to. The shower is amazing. It is huge with two shower heads, endless hot water, and makes you feel like you are liberated without a shower door. After long days exploring and hiking, we enjoyed taking a dip in the water hole, made bonfires under beautiful stars and even watched a movie.
If you are lucky, you will get to meet the talented and truly amazing, Cappie. Talking to him was one of our highlights. He is so attentive to make sure your stay is comfortable and you have all you need. Plus, he genuinely builds relationships with those around him.
We are amazed with the craftsmanship of the home and every detail put in! It was such a great trip. This place will not disappoint.

review_text:
This was a great place to stay! It was clean, well-kept, and on a beautiful piece of property that is fairly secluded (though not as much as some of the pictures may suggest). The hosts were very communicative and offered suggestions of events that were happening. The binder of info they provided about the cottage and the town was useful and informative. Overall it was a very pleasant visit!
There is one thing that was enough of a problem to warrant the 4 stars. If you are at all sensitive to noise, the fan on the compost toilet is loud enough that you hear it everywhere in the cabin (at least when I stayed in June 2022). You can even hear it while watching TV. It made it difficult to fall asleep because it is not pleasant. It was a relief when the fridge would kick on and drown out the noise in a more pleasant sound.
Another note is if you do go in the swimming hole, it is shared or right on the border with another property (which I believe they also rent out). That's fine by me but not well represented.

review_text: One of the joys of travel is getting to stay in places that you would never otherwise have a chance to try living in, and this location is that to a tee. This place is an experience unlike any I have ever had, from the floor up (literally; even the adobe flooring was a new experience for me!). Not only is the location fun and interestingâ€”Spearfish is the perfect combination of "small enough to enjoy" and "large enough to have some conveniences"â€”but the building itself is a joy to stay in. It's design is rustic and interesting, but it does not sacrifice in comfort anywhere, from the spacious shower (with ample hot water) to the luxurious bed. If you're anywhere in the area, you owe it to yourself to spend a night or two here and just experience a different way of living.

review_text:
Beautiful one bedroom home that is fully furnished. It's more than a house that's off the grid it's a work of art. We didn't run out of electricity (we had a lot of devices iPads iPhones etc). Hot water was perfect. When you meet Cappy to check in ask him where the locals eat for excellent restaurants. It's located in the city but you don't feel like your in the city. It's safe. It's close to a lot of major tourist attractions. Spearfish itself is really nice and is very eclectic. We were told to check out spearfish canyon and I am so glad we did. There are all these elements close by and then return to the home to freshen up. Look out the picture window late at night deer always came to visit.
Cappy and his wife are the nicest couple. Once you check in and get the tour they leave so you have privacy they are not helicopter hosts. Its also very clean and organized. I'm really glad I had this experience it's worth it.

review_text:
Myself, my husband and two of his younger brothers (15&19) and our dog stayed here for 1 night on our way from Minnesota to Red Lodge. The cabin was perfect! Beds were comfy, we brought an air mattress so the boys didn't have to share and there was plenty of room in the main area. Couch is comfy, fire stick available for tv viewing, AC kept us nice and cool on a hot day, kitchen is well appointed, we made dinner at the cabin with no issues. Far enough off the highway to feel super private but only a 10 minute drive to the heart of Spearfish. We checked out the Spearfish Canyon Disc golf course and would recommend that for sure, as a non-disc golfer myself it was a really beautiful hike.
Overall we would recommend and stay again!

There was house construction (remodeling) going on next door that started at 7:00 am. Fortunately, we were getting up early anyway.
Overall, a great place to stay in Spearfish.

review_text: Great place to stay especially if you're wanting to be close to the BHSU campus. The newly remodeled unit was as described. I tend to do a lot of cooking when Im in Spearfish because our kiddo misses home cooked meals which is why we don't stay at hotels. I like to feel at home when staying in an ABnB so the small things matter. The kitchen was well stocked with most of what you'd need except there were no potholders to get food out of the oven and no salt and pepper. I will add though that this is one of the first places Ive stayed that actually had decent cutting knives so that was a PLUS. Also, if you plan to have more than 2 sleepers or like extra pillows bring them as there were only 2. Overall it was a great place to stay and an easy check-in process is always appreciated.

Checkout was a bit early for us (10:00 am), so we headed over to Common Grounds for coffee and unique breakfast sandwiches â€” a great way to start the day!! The only tip I have for our wonderful host is to please not use fabric softener on the towels (not only does it make them less absorbent, but it's unhealthy for people with chemical and scent sensitivities). We only stayed 1 night but it was a great stay for that night ğŸ¥° Everything was clean and the hot tub was great ğŸ‘ There's a couple of eateries and a brewery right across the street (walking distance), which is amazing. My only wish is that it was communicated in the description that this tiny home is in what seems to be a little tiny home/mobile home community so it's not quite as private as we were expecting from the reviews. The neighbors were quiet but the deck with the hot tub is right next to the tiny home next door so you can hear others talking when you're trying to just rest and relax. While it was a nice stay for being close to town and a 20 minute drive from amazing hikes, we definitely felt the price was pretty steep for what it was. Aside from those couple of things, we were absolutely thrilled with our stay.

Even though the home is technically in town, it feels secluded with the hot tub facing the greenery, and a privacy wall next to it. We enjoyed a good soak and watched the starry night sky. There's a neat guest book where people have left their notes on what's good to do in the area if you need suggestions. Would definitely stay again!

The guest book inside is a great guide from past guests with activity and restaurant recommendations! We had never stayed in a tiny home before and had a total blast exploring the area and enjoying the space and hot tub. Jackie has thought of everything and has put so much care into this space. We messaged her once or twice with questions and she got right back to us! Also, the proximity to both I90 and local shops and restaurants is ideal. Do not hesitate to book this Airbnb!!

review_text: WOW! This place is perfect for a couples getaway! All of the comforts and cleanliness of a hotel suite but secluded and quiet in the woods. Also just a five minute drive to downtown shops and restaurants. Lang keeps a very new and clean property and there is even a yoga/meditation platform on the property and an archery range a half mile down the road. You are only 30 minutes from Spearfish Canyon and Black Hills Forest and 1.5 hours away from Badlands, Jewel Cave and Wind Cave. In our opinion, it was well worth a little extra drive time to have absolute quiet and calm in the evenings. Deer in the neighborhood too! A great value. We will be staying here on our next venture up to the Black Hills for sure. Thanks!

Stayed one night
review_text: 5 Stars are not enough stars for Lang's awesome place. I've stayed in well over 50 AirBnBs and this was one of the best. Really beautifully designed and crafted interior. Every amenity you can think of, and all artfully done. And the incredible exterior -- a fabulous wild game (including deer, eagles, coyotes and turkeys) area is right outside the door. A beautiful ridge (great hiking space) runs just behind the property and the Black Hills National Forest is a short ride up the road. Plus this perfect space (for up to 4 guests, including the bunk beds) is integrated into the geodesic-dome compound of the host's internationally- renowned artistic family. That's the excellent frosting on this really excellent cake. I can't recommend it highly enough! If you're visiting the Black Hills, stay here! You won't be sorry.
